<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#acb6e60cad24aed54fa19ce71074c7ecb"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">operator</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">delete</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Usr, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/user/intrusiveoperandsanddescriptorallocmarker">IntrusiveOperandsAndDescriptorAllocMarker</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to restore the changed information to the original value, since the dtor of that class</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is not called if the ctor fails.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="normal">    User::operator </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">delete</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(Usr);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Subclasses with hung off uses need to manage the operand count</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// themselves.  In these instances, the operand count isn&#39;t used to find the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// OperandList, so there&#39;s no issue in having the operand count change.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#a715e8009737f71c4b3d2ea7d2abc33c4"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#a715e8009737f71c4b3d2ea7d2abc33c4">setNumHungOffUseOperands</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a536e22898d28a9340a4204407a75ad5d">NumOps</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#abe68086704afcf3325b6b9b14ca4b625">HasHungOffUses</a> &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Must have hung off uses to use this method&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a536e22898d28a9340a4204407a75ad5d">NumOps</a> &lt; (1u &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a19833a77591e9d860373ab7fc4793044a6050aee72ddd23b6d91ec3f126679fec">NumUserOperandsBits</a>) &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Too many operands&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A droppable user is a user for which uses can be dropped without affecting</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// correctness and should be dropped rather than preventing a transformation</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// from happening.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#af6a49991304b167c94f4a9756d3fd48f">isDroppable</a>() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ---------------------------------------------------------------------------</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Operand Iterator interface...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Drop all references to operands.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This function is in charge of &quot;letting go&quot; of all objects that this User</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// refers to.  This allows one to &#39;delete&#39; a whole class at a time, even</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// though there may be circular references...  First all references are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// dropped, and all use counts go to zero.  Then everything is deleted for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// real.  Note that no operations are valid on an object that has &quot;dropped</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// all references&quot;, except operator delete.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#a48ec5fcee6d2c17c723e8e67f169f948"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#a48ec5fcee6d2c17c723e8e67f169f948">dropAllReferences</a>() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> &amp;U : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#a0b931781aa589c6ebe64a76c1447e5b2">operands</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><Highlight kind="normal">      U.set(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
